title: Selecting the Right Technology for the Future
summary: In this case study, see how I used a consultant mindset to lead a client team through migrating an existing application from KnockoutJS to Vue 3 + Typescript.

children.value: "Different pieces of technology kind of go in cycles they have their springs and summers and autumns and then they…go to the graveyard of technology and so we try to pick things that are in their springs and if you choose wisely you can save yourself an enormous amount of work...and you can really put energy into making those new emerging technologies great on your platform."

Inspired by one of my favorite quotes from Steve Jobs, I talk about how I led a client team through an iterative migration of a production application. The process I took when leading the move from the older framework of KnockoutJS to the increasingly popular framework Vue.js with TypeScript is explained in this case study.

title: Cultivating a Consultant Mindset in Developers
description: All developers have the potential to be innovative and disruptive game changers on each project they touch. The consultant mindset — a frame of mind that embraces measured, creative, critical thinking — isn't just about projects, it can empower entire organizations.
summary: How can developers be their own consultant and positively impact the technical strategy of their organization? It's easier than you think.

children.value: All developers have the potential to be innovative and disruptive game changers on each project they touch. The consultant mindset — a frame of mind that embraces measured, creative, critical thinking — isn't just about projects, it can empower entire organizations.

In this cornerstone article featured as part of the Consultant Mindset for Developer series, I talk about how developers can adopt this mindset and become internal consultants that shape the technical trajectory to benefit their organization.

title: Pull Requests Like a Pro with Commit Curation
description: The commit history in your pull requests can be a valuable tool to onboard your reviewer to your changes. By carefully editing your commits, you can effortlessly guide your fellow developers through your thought process in a way that is decoupled from the actual chronology of changes.
summary: Speed up the pull request review process and efficiently onboarding your reviewer by curating your commits using interactive rebasing.

children.value: The commit history in your pull requests can be a valuable tool to onboard your reviewer to your changes. By carefully editing your commits, you can effortlessly guide your fellow developers through your thought process in a way that is decoupled from the actual chronology of changes.
In this article, I talk about how you can speed up the PR process by curating your commits with interactive rebasing.

title: Advanced Techniques in Git
description: Git is so much more than a chronological ledger of changes. You might use Git as a collaboration tool to synchronize code changes between developers, but are you capturing the growth of your codebase?
summary: Your codebase is a untapped trove of context and evolution. Learn how to use Git's interactive rebasing to take control of your repository and edit your commit history.

children.value: Git is so much more than a chronological ledger of changes. You might use Git as a collaboration tool to synchronize code changes between developers, but are you capturing the growth of your codebase?
In this article, I go over techniques that you can use in your projects to elevate the history of your codebase as a valuable source of context and evolution.

title: Why You Should be Black-Box Testing Your Web Application Data Stores
description: Application stores are required for large-scale web applications. Between mutators, actions, and getters, testing these stores can be tricky.
summary: Spend less time writing tests without sacrificing coverage or confidence.

children.value: Application stores are required for large-scale web applications. Between mutators, actions, and getters, testing these stores can be tricky.
In this article, I talk about how using a black-box testing approach can reduce the time you're devoting to writing tests without sacrificing any of the thoroughness.

title: Calling All Mutants: Mutation Testing with Stryker
description: Your project has unit tests. Your project has 100% test coverage. But what if your tests are susceptible to reporting false positives? We write unit tests to build confidence that our code performs as expected, but how can you be confident that your tests are making the right assertions against your code?
summary: You have 100% code coverage, but can you trust you tests? Learn how to have confidence in your tests by adding Stryker to your project.

children.value: Your project has unit tests. Your project has 100% test coverage. But what if your tests are susceptible to reporting false positives? In this article, I talk about how mutation testing can increase the reliability and robustness of your existing unit tests.

title: Let Your Feature Flag Fly
description: If you use Twitter, Facebook, or Netflix, chances are that you've encountered feature flags: small, logical operators that control which features are executed and which ones are not.
summary: Gradually deploy your site's features using feature flags.

children.value: If you use Twitter, Facebook, or Netflix, chances are that you've encountered feature flags: small, logical operators that control which features are executed and which ones are not.
In this article, I talk about how feature flags can be used to gradually deploy features to your customers and avoid deployment rollbacks.
